page.title: 15Meriden-The Woodmen of Arden
page.content:
On the edge of Meriden there stands the Forest Hall and Forest Ground. Here a Society of Archers known as { {"The Woodmen of Arden"}hold their meetings. These archers shoot with the traditional longbows and their meetings, in their present form, were revived on the Old Forest Ground im 1785.
Deposited in the Forest Hall is a horn said to have been used by{Robin Hood} who, according to tradition, competedf here in olden times.
The King's Bodyguard of Scotland, the Royal Company of Archers, compete with the Woodmen of Arden every three years for the Scotch Cup, the venue alternating between Meriden and Scotland.
